*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to central committee Mexico, July 24, 1833. Reporting incidents of journey. Officials friendly and he hopes for success. Advises organization of State government if petition is denied.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*City of Mexico*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="07-24-1833">July 24, 1833*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*To the *person_mentioned*Central Committee*/person_mentioned*:*/p*
*p*My letter from *location_mentioned*Vera-Cruz*/location_mentioned*, dated *date_mentioned n="07-03-1833">3d instant*/date_mentioned*, informed you of the many untoward circumstances that retarded my journey to that place. When I wrote from *location_mentioned*Matamoras*/location_mentioned*, on the *date_mentioned n="05-30-1833">30th May*/date_mentioned*, I expected to have reached *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* in Six days, and this place in six or seven more, I left *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* on the *date_mentioned n="07-05-1833">5th */date_mentioned*in the stage, and arrived at *location_mentioned*Jalapa */location_mentioned*on the *date_mentioned n="05-06-1833">6th*/date_mentioned*, where I received information of the siege of *location_mentioned*Puebla */location_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*Arista */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Duran*/person_mentioned*—-and that the road was occupied on both sides of the city of *location_mentioned*Puebla */location_mentioned*by their *person_mentioned*troops*/person_mentioned*, and all communication with *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*cut off. On the *date_mentioned n="07-08-1833">8th */date_mentioned*I was told that the stage was allowed to pass the lines, though the danger of *person_mentioned*robbers */person_mentioned*was great— and I intended to have proceeded in the stage on the *date_mentioned n="07-09-1833">9th*/date_mentioned*, But on that day a new and unexpected difficulty arose—my passport was from the *person_mentioned*Commandant General, D. Vincente Filisola*/person_mentioned*, and it was therefore necessary to present myself to the *person_mentioned*military authorities*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*on the road.*/location_mentioned* At *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned* I called twice (on the *date_mentioned n="07-02-1833">2d*/date_mentioned*, the day I landed, and on the *date_mentioned n="07-03-1833">3d*/date_mentioned*) on the *person_mentioned*Commandant General*/person_mentioned* of that place, and exhibited my passport. He told me verbally I could proceed on my journey, but did not endorse my passport. Owing to the want of this formality, I was detained at *location_mentioned*Jalapa */location_mentioned*by the *person_mentioned*commandant*/person_mentioned*, and could not proceed until I sent to *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned*, so that I did not reach this place until the *date_mentioned n="07-18-1833">18th inst*/date_mentioned*. *location_mentioned*Puebla */location_mentioned*was heroically defended by *person_mentioned*Gen. Guadalupe Victoria*/person_mentioned*, with the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*of the *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*, hastily collected for the purpose. The *person_mentioned*regular troops*/person_mentioned* had all gone over to the other side previously, and left *person_mentioned*Victoria */person_mentioned*without any resources except the patriotism of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Puebla*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. With the *person_mentioned*militia */person_mentioned*he defeated *person_mentioned*Arista */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Duran */person_mentioned*in their attempt to get possession of the *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*; and they retreated to the vicinity of this *location_mentioned*city*/location_mentioned*. They are now *location_mentioned*within four leagues*/location_mentioned*, on the retreat, in the direction of *location_mentioned*Queretaro*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Santa Anna */person_mentioned*is in close pursuit of them, and no doubt is entertained of a speedy termination of the *person_mentioned*crusaders */person_mentioned*and the final triumph of the *person_mentioned*liberal party*/person_mentioned*. I presume you have seen the Plan of *person_mentioned*Arista and Duran*/person_mentioned*—its basis is Religeon and a large standing *person_mentioned*Army*/person_mentioned*. They will fail in toto, and the result will be another triumph for *person_mentioned*Santa Anna */person_mentioned*and a complete dissolution of the *person_mentioned*aristocratic party*/person_mentioned* and influence.*/p*
*p*I called on the *person_mentioned*Ministers */person_mentioned*on the *date_mentioned n="07-19-1833">19th*/date_mentioned*, and they appointed the *date_mentioned n="07-23-1833">23d */date_mentioned*(yesterday) to have an interview on the subject of my mission. I also called on the *person_mentioned*Vice-President*/person_mentioned*; my reception was truly kind and friendly, particularly in the interview yesterday with the *person_mentioned*two Ministers of Relations and Justice, Garcia and Arispe*/person_mentioned*. They were fully informed of the objects of my Mission by my communication from *location_mentioned*Matamoras */location_mentioned*through the *person_mentioned*Commandant Gen*/person_mentioned*. and had received the memorial of the Convention which I forwarded from that place. I explained at large and with some detail the situation of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* and the necessity of erecting it into a *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned*. The leading points on which I rested our claims were:*/p*
*p*First—The wish of the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*and their declaration that they possessed the necessary elements to sustain a *person_mentioned*State Government*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Second—The natural right of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to occupy its station alongside of its sisters, the other *location_mentioned*States of the Confederation*/location_mentioned*. It has always been a distinct *location_mentioned*member of the Mexican family*/location_mentioned* and as such fought for the Independence, etc., and its being for a time under age did not in any manner weaken its rights now that it was in a situation to enter upon them, etc.*/p*
*p*Third—The law of the *date_mentioned n="05-07-1824">7th May, 1824*/date_mentioned*. I positively denied the right of *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*to approve or disapprove of our separation. also stated that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*did not, and would not, recognize the principle that it was necessary to apply to the other *location_mentioned*states */location_mentioned*of the *location_mentioned*confederation */location_mentioned*for their approbation. We were now entering upon a natural and imprescriptable right, which belonged to us before the formation of the Constitution, and one which the provisional union with *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*did not, and could not, weaken in any manner whatever, etc.*/p*
*p*Fourth—The duty and the interest of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to cement and strengthen its union with the *location_mentioned*Mexican confederation*/location_mentioned*—the indirect union as an appendage of *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*being very precarious, and liable to be broken at any time.*/p*
*p*Lastly—The right and the duty of every *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*to save themselves from anarchy and ruin! On this last point I enlarged very much, as I also did on the 4th. I distinctly stated as my opinion that self-preservation would compel the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to organize a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned*, with or without the approbation of the *person_mentioned*General Government*/person_mentioned*—that this measure would not proceed from any hostle views to the permanent union of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*with *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, but from absolute necessity, to save themselves from anarchy and total ruin. How such a measure would affect the union of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*with *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, or where it would end, were matters worthy of serious reflection.*/p*
*p*I will give the answer of the two *person_mentioned*Ministers*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Garcia */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Arispe*/person_mentioned*, as nearly verbatim as I can recollect. I do not pledge myself for the accuracy of the words, but I do for that of the substance:*/p*
*p*This *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*will examine the pretensions of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to become a *location_mentioned*State of this Confederation*/location_mentioned*, with the most friendly disposition towards the *person_mentioned*people of that *location_mentioned*remote section*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and in conformity with the broad and liberal principles of the federal system, adopted by the *location_mentioned*Mexican Republic*/location_mentioned*, We wish to see every portion of the *location_mentioned*confederation */location_mentioned*governed in accordance with these principles, and of those of the age in which we live. We admit that *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* has just cause to complain of the *person_mentioned*Legislature of *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, The *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* may therefore expect that their application will be considered, and their just requests granted, so far as it is within The Constitutional powers of the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*to grant them.*/p*
*p*The interview was long, and frank. I was requested to put my ideas in writing. They are pretty much all embraced in the Memorial, but I thought it would be better to condense them under separate heads or points.*/p*
*p*So soon as I get the Constitution translated and a new translation of the Memorial (the first being defective) I will lay the whole matter before the *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I believe that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*will be a *location_mentioned*State of this Confederation*/location_mentioned* with the approbation of this *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*before long. I form this opinion from the information of many persons of influence, all of whom confirm the friendly disposition expressed by the *person_mentioned*Ministers*/person_mentioned*. Should I be incorrect in this conclusion there will be but one course, one remedy left, and that is for *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to adopt the alternative I informed the *person_mentioned*Ministers */person_mentioned*self preservation would compel it to adopt. The *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*therefore must organize without any more applications or delay.*/p*
*p*It is pretty well known in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*that I have pursued conciliation as a system; some think I have adhered to it too long, and too obstinately. I do not think so, placed under the circumstances I was. However, this is a mere matter of opinion and is of no consequence. My conciliatory course has not compromised any of the rights of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*; on the contrary, it has settled that *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and in times past saved it from many evils. Clamors and importunities could not force me from my old rule. You ought, therefore, to believe that my judgment is now convinced that *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, in this question of right to become a *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned*, must be uncompromising. I am placed in a situation here to form a more correct opinion as to what course will be best calculated to secure the prosperity of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and its permanent union with *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, than I was in that remote section.*/p*
*p*I therefore reiterate the opinion, and I place it on the footing of a recommendation, that should our application be refused, *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* ought to organize a *person_mentioned*local government*/person_mentioned* with as little delay as possible—but always on the basis that it is a part of the *location_mentioned*Mexican Confederation*/location_mentioned*, a younger sister who adopts this mode of entering upon her rights, now that she is of age, because unnecessary embarrassments are interposed which are unconstitutional, unjust, inexpedient and ruinous.*/p*
*p*I also recommend tranquillity and obedience to the laws—these are the first duties of a *person_mentioned*citizen*/person_mentioned*. Wait for a definite answer. The moment I get one, or am convinced that delay is the object, I will leave here and hasten *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*to unite in executing the recommendations I have made.*/p*
*p*Your Fellow-Citizen and Obedient Servant.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
